page.title: 05Folk Lore from Tongue
page.content: Long ago in the mists of time, a boar went devouring cattle and sheep. One brave warrior from Ireland came to look for the boar and he found it on one of the faces of {Ben Loyal. }The warrior and the boar started to fight. They fought on and on and then the warrior lunged forward and drove his sword deep into the boar's heart. The great beast died instantly. It fell down the rocky face, and as it fell , it left a great scratch down the mountainside. The warrior walked over the beast to measure it, but he died because the boar's poisonous bristles pierced his feet. The mark can still be seen on the face of Ben Loyal and is known as the Boar's Scratch.
